item.title: A little bit of Bashfu for a specific case of log analysis
item.description: This post is not about a solution to a generic issue. This post is about how I found some way to cut and assemble a large log file using a few Bash tools (and subliminally why Unix principle of implementing stuff may be the superior way). So today, there came a need to sort through a large access log file for a list of request counts for each key. It’s not just a key — request count relationship.
